rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: طسٓ ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَكِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: Ta Sin! These are the verses of the Quran and the Book that makes (things) clear
rows.transliteration: ṭā sīn ۚ tilka āyātul qur-āni wakitābin mubīn

rows.arabic: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: A guidance and good news for the believers,
rows.transliteration: hudan wabushrā lil-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
rows.translation: Who keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate, and of the hereafter, they are sure.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yuqīmūnaṣ ṣalāta wayu-tūnaz zakāta wahum bil-ākhirati hum yūqinūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
rows.translation: As to those who do not believe in the hereafter, We have surely made their deeds fair-seeming to them, but they blindly wander on.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bil-ākhirati zayyannā lahum a`mālahum fahum ya`mahūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ
rows.translation: These are they who shall have an evil punishment, and in the hereafter they shall be the greatest losers.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīna lahum sū-ul `adhābi wahum fil-ākhirati humul-akhsarūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: And most surely you are made to receive the Quran from the Wise, the Knowing Allah.
rows.transliteration: wa innaka latulaqqal qur-āna min ladun ḥakīmin `alīm

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِۦٓ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًا سَـَٔاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ ءَاتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
rows.translation: When Musa said to his family: Surely I see fire; I will bring to you from it some news, or I will bring to you therefrom a burning firebrand so that you may warm yourselves.
rows.transliteration: idh qāla mūsā li-ahlihi innī ānastu nāran sa-ātīkum minhā bikhabarin aw ātīkum bishihābin qabasin la`allakum taṣṭalūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِىَ أَنۢ بُورِكَ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: So when he came to it a voice was uttered saying: Blessed is Whoever is in the fire and whatever is about it; and glory be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds;
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-ahā nūdiya an būrika man fin nāri wa man ḥawlahā wasubḥānallāhi rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: O Musa! surely I am Allah, the Mighty, the Wise;
rows.transliteration: yāmūsā innahu anallāhul `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّى لَا يَخَافُ لَدَىَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
rows.translation: And cast down your staff. So when he saw it in motion as if it were a serpent, he turned back retreating and did not return: O Musa! fear not; surely the apostles shall not fear in My presence;
rows.transliteration: wa-alqi `aṣāk ۚ falammā ra-āhā tahtazzu ka-annahā jānnun wallā mudbiran walam yu`aqqib ۚ yāmūsā lā takhaf innī lā yakhāfu ladayyal mursalūn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًۢا بَعْدَ سُوٓءٍ فَإِنِّى غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Neither he who has been unjust, then he does good instead after evil, for surely I am the Forgiving, the Merciful:
rows.transliteration: illā man ẓalama thumma baddala ḥusnan ba`da sū-in fa-innī ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍ ۖ فِى تِسْعِ ءَايَـٰتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا فَـٰسِقِينَ
rows.translation: And enter your hand into the opening of your bosom, it shall come forth white without evil; among nine signs to Firon and his people, surely they are a transgressing people.
rows.transliteration: wa-adkhil yadaka fī jaybika takhruj bayḍā-a min ghayri sū-ī ۖ fī tis`i āyātin ilā fir`awna waqawmih ۚ innahum kānū qawman fāsiqīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْهُمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا مُبْصِرَةً قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: So when Our clear signs came to them, they said: This is clear enchantment.
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-at hum āyātunā mubṣiratan qālū hādhā siḥrun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَجَحَدُوا۟ بِهَا وَٱسْتَيْقَنَتْهَآ أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًا وَعُلُوًّا ۚ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: And they denied them unjustly and proudly while their soul had been convinced of them; consider, then how was the end of the mischief-makers.
rows.transliteration: wajaḥadū bihā wastayqanat-hā anfusuhum ẓul-man wa`uluwwā ۚ fanẓur kayfa kāna `āqibatul mufsidīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيْمَـٰنَ عِلْمًا ۖ وَقَالَا ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And certainly We gave knowledge to Dawood and Sulaiman, and they both said: Praise be to Allah, Who has made us to excel many of His believing servants.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ātaynā dāwūda wasulaymāna `il-mā ۖ waqālal ḥamdu lillāhil ladhī faḍḍalanā `alā kathīrin min `ibādihil mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَـٰنُ دَاوُۥدَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنطِقَ ٱلطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْفَضْلُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
rows.translation: And Sulaiman was Dawood's heir, and he said: O men! we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given all things; most surely this is manifest grace.
rows.transliteration: wawaritha sulaymānu dāwūd ۖ waqāla yā-ayyuhan nāsu `ullimnā manṭiqaṭ ṭayri wa-ūtīnā min kulli shay-ī ۖ inna hādhā lahuwal faḍlul mubīn

rows.arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَـٰنَ جُنُودُهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ وَٱلطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
rows.translation: And his hosts of the jinn and the men and the birds were gathered to him, and they were formed into groups.
rows.transliteration: waḥushira lisulaymāna junūduhu minal jinni wal-insi waṭ ṭayri fahum yūza`ūn

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ وَادِ ٱلنَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّمْلُ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ مَسَـٰكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَـٰنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Until when they came to the valley of the Naml, a Namlite said: O Naml! enter your houses, (that) Sulaiman and his hosts may not crush you while they do not know.
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā ataw `alā wādin namli qālat namlatun yā-ayyuhan namlud-khulū masākinakum lā yaḥṭimannakum sulaymānu wajunūduhu wahum lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًا مِّن قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِىٓ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَىَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَٰلِدَىَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَـٰلِحًا تَرْضَىٰهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِى بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِى عِبَادِكَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: So he smiled, wondering at her word, and said: My Lord! grant me that I should be grateful for Thy favor which Thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I should do good such as Thou art pleased with, and make me enter, by Thy mercy, into Thy servants, the good ones.
rows.transliteration: fatabassama ḍāḥikan min qawlihā waqāla rabbi awzi`nī an ashkura ni`matakal latī an`amta `alayya wa`alā wālidayya wa-an a`mala ṣāliḥan tarḍāhu wa-adkhilnī biraḥmatika fī `ibādikaṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ ٱلطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِىَ لَآ أَرَى ٱلْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْغَآئِبِينَ
rows.translation: And he reviewed the birds, then said: How is it I see not the hoopoe or is it that he is of the absentees?
rows.transliteration: watafaqqadaṭ ṭayra faqāla mā liya lā aral hud-huda am kāna minal ghā-ibīn

rows.arabic: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُۥ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَا۟ذْبَحَنَّهُۥٓ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّى بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: I will most certainly punish him with a severe punishment, or kill him, or he shall bring to me a clear plea.
rows.transliteration: la-u`adhhibannahu `adhāban shadīdan aw la-adhbaḥannahu aw laya-tiyannī bisulṭānin mubīn

rows.arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍۭ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ
rows.translation: And he tarried not long, then said: I comprehend that which you do not comprehend and I have brought to you a sure information from Sheba.
rows.transliteration: famakatha ghayra ba`īdin faqāla aḥaṭtu bimā lam tuḥiṭ bihi waji-tuka min saba-in binaba-in yaqīn

rows.arabic: إِنِّى وَجَدتُّ ٱمْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: Surely I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given abundance and she has a mighty throne:
rows.transliteration: innī wajadtum-ra-atan tamlikuhum wa-ūtiyat min kulli shay-in walahā `arshun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: I found her and her people adoring the sun instead of Allah, and the Shaitan has made their deeds fair-seeming to them and thus turned them from the way, so they do not go aright
rows.transliteration: wajadtuhā waqawmahā yasjudūna lishhamsi min dūnillāhi wazayyana lahumush shayṭānu a`mālahum faṣaddahum `anis sabīli fahum lā yahtadūn

rows.arabic: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى يُخْرِجُ ٱلْخَبْءَ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
rows.translation: That they do not make obeisance to Allah, Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows what you hide and what you make manifest:
rows.transliteration: allā yasjudū lillāhil ladhī yukhrijul khab a fis samāwāti wal-arḍi waya`lamu mā tukhfūna wa mā tu`linūn

rows.arabic: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ ۩
rows.translation: Allah, there is no god but He: He is the Lord of mighty power.
rows.transliteration: allāhu lā ilāha illā huwa rabbul `arshil `aẓīm ۩

rows.arabic: قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: He said: We will see whether you have told the truth or whether you are of the liars:
rows.transliteration: qāla sananẓuru aṣadaqta am kunta minal kādhibīn

rows.arabic: ٱذْهَب بِّكِتَـٰبِى هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
rows.translation: Take this my letter and hand it over to them, then turn away from them and see what (answer) they return.
rows.transliteration: idh-hab bikitābī hādhā fa-alqih ilayhim thumma tawalla `anhum fanẓur mādhā yarji`ūn

rows.arabic: قَالَتْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ إِنِّىٓ أُلْقِىَ إِلَىَّ كِتَـٰبٌ كَرِيمٌ
rows.translation: She said: O chief! surely an honorable letter has been delivered to me
rows.transliteration: qālat yā-ayyuhal mala-u innī ulqiya ilayya kitābun karīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِن سُلَيْمَـٰنَ وَإِنَّهُۥ بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: Surely it is from Sulaiman, and surely it is in the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful;
rows.transliteration: innahu min sulaymāna wa innahu bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا۟ عَلَىَّ وَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: Saying: exalt not yourselves against me and come to me in submission.
rows.transliteration: allā ta`lū `alayya wa-tūnī muslimīn

rows.arabic: قَالَتْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَفْتُونِى فِىٓ أَمْرِى مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
rows.translation: She said: O chiefs! give me advice respecting my affair: I never decide an affair until you are in my presence.
rows.transliteration: qālat yā-ayyuhal mala-u aftūnī fī amrī mā kuntu qāṭi`atan amran ḥattā tash-hadūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَحْنُ أُو۟لُوا۟ قُوَّةٍ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَٱلْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَٱنظُرِى مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
rows.translation: They said: We are possessors of strength and possessors of mighty prowess, and the command is yours, therefore see what you will command.
rows.transliteration: qālū naḥnu ulū quwwatin wa-ulū ba-sin shadīdin wal-amru ilayki fanẓurī mādhā ta-murīn

rows.arabic: قَالَتْ إِنَّ ٱلْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا۟ قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوٓا۟ أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَآ أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
rows.translation: She said: Surely the kings, when they enter a town, ruin it and make the noblest of its people to be low, and thus they (always) do;
rows.transliteration: qālat innal mulūka idhā dakhalū qaryatan afsadūhā waja`alū a`izzata ahlihā adhillah ۖ wakadhālika yaf`alūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنِّى مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌۢ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
rows.translation: And surely I am going to send a present to them, and shall wait to see what (answer) do the apostles bring back.
rows.transliteration: wa innī mursilatun ilayhim bihadiyyatin fanāẓiratun bima yarji`ul mursalūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ سُلَيْمَـٰنَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَآ ءَاتَىٰنِۦَ ٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّآ ءَاتَىٰكُم بَلْ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
rows.translation: So when he came to Sulaiman, he said: What! will you help me with wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Nay, you are exultant because of your present;
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-a sulaymāna qāla atumiddūnani bimālin famā ātāniyallāhu khayrun mimmā ātākum bal antum bihadiyyatikum tafraḥūn

rows.arabic: ٱرْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَآ أَذِلَّةً وَهُمْ صَـٰغِرُونَ
rows.translation: Go back to them, so we will most certainly come to them with hosts which they shall have no power to oppose, and we will most certainly expel them therefrom in abasement, and they shall be in a state of ignominy.
rows.transliteration: irji` ilayhim falana-tiyannahum bijunūdin lā qibala lahum bihā walanukhrijannahum minhā adhillatan wahum ṣāghirūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِى بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: He said: O chiefs! which of you can bring to me her throne before they come to me in submission?
rows.transliteration: qāla yā-ayyuhal mala-u ayyukum ya-tīnī bi`arshihā qabla an ya-tūnī muslimīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ ۖ وَإِنِّى عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِىٌّ أَمِينٌ
rows.translation: One audacious among the jinn said: I will bring it to you before you rise up from your place; and most surely I am strong (and) trusty for it.
rows.transliteration: qāla `ifrītun minal jinni ana ātīka bihi qabla an taqūma min maqāmik ۖ wa innī `alayhi laqawiyyun amīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِى عِندَهُۥ عِلْمٌ مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُۥ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّى لِيَبْلُوَنِىٓ ءَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّى غَنِىٌّ كَرِيمٌ
rows.translation: One who had the knowledge of the Book said: I will bring it to you in the twinkling of an eye. Then when he saw it settled beside him, he said: This is of the grace of my Lord that He may try me whether I am grateful or ungrateful; and whoever is grateful, he is grateful only for his own soul, and whoever is ungrateful, then surely my Lord is Self-sufficient, Honored.
rows.transliteration: qālal ladhī `indahu `il-mun minal kitābi ana ātīka bihi qabla an yartadda ilayka ṭarfuk ۚ falammā ra-āhu mustaqirran `indahu qāla hādhā min faḍli rabbī liyabluwanī a-ashkuru am akfur ۖ wa man shakara fa-innamā yashkuru linafsih ۖ wa man kafara fa-inna rabbī ghaniyyun karīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ نَكِّرُوا۟ لَهَا عَرْشَهَا نَنظُرْ أَتَهْتَدِىٓ أَمْ تَكُونُ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: He said: Alter her throne for her, we will see whether she follows the right way or is of those who do not go aright.
rows.transliteration: qāla nakkirū lahā `arshahā nanẓur atahtadī am takūnu minal ladhīna lā yahtadūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ قِيلَ أَهَـٰكَذَا عَرْشُكِ ۖ قَالَتْ كَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ ۚ وَأُوتِينَا ٱلْعِلْمَ مِن قَبْلِهَا وَكُنَّا مُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: So when she came, it was said: Is your throne like this? She said: It is as it were the same, and we were given the knowledge before it, and we were submissive.
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-at qīla ahākadhā `arshuk ۖ qālat ka-annahu huw ۚ wa-ūtīnal `il-ma min qablihā wakunnā muslimīn

rows.arabic: وَصَدَّهَا مَا كَانَت تَّعْبُدُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهَا كَانَتْ مِن قَوْمٍ كَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And what she worshipped besides Allah prevented her, surely she was of an unbelieving people.
rows.transliteration: waṣaddahā mā kānat ta`budu min dūnillāh ۖ innahā kānat min qawmin kāfirīn

rows.arabic: قِيلَ لَهَا ٱدْخُلِى ٱلصَّرْحَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَتْهُ حَسِبَتْهُ لُجَّةً وَكَشَفَتْ عَن سَاقَيْهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ صَرْحٌ مُّمَرَّدٌ مِّن قَوَارِيرَ ۗ قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّى ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِى وَأَسْلَمْتُ مَعَ سُلَيْمَـٰنَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: It was said to her: Enter the palace; but when she saw it she deemed it to be a great expanse of water, and bared her legs. He said: Surely it is a palace made smooth with glass. She said: My Lord! surely I have been unjust to myself, and I submit with Sulaiman to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
rows.transliteration: qīla lahad-khuliṣ ṣarḥ ۖ falammā ra-at-hu ḥasibat-hu lujjatan wakashafat `an sāqayhā ۚ qāla innahu ṣarḥun mumarradun min qawārīr ۗ qālat rabbi innī ẓalamtu nafsī wa-aslamtu ma`a sulaymāna lillāhi rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَـٰلِحًا أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ فَإِذَا هُمْ فَرِيقَانِ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
rows.translation: And certainly We sent to Samood their brother Salih, saying: Serve Allah; and lo! they became two sects quarrelling with each other.
rows.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā ilā thamūda akhāhum ṣāliḥan ani'-budullāha fa-idhā hum farīqāni yakhtaṣimūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ ۖ لَوْلَا تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
rows.translation: He said: O my people! why do you seek to hasten on the evil before the good? Why do you not ask forgiveness of Allah so that you may be dealt with mercifully?
rows.transliteration: qāla yāqawmi lima tasta`jilūna bis sayyi-ati qablal-ḥasanah ۖ lawlā tastaghfirūnallāha la`allakum turḥamūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱطَّيَّرْنَا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَّعَكَ ۚ قَالَ طَـٰٓئِرُكُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تُفْتَنُونَ
rows.translation: They said: We have met with ill luck on account of you and on account of those with you. He said: The cause of your evil fortune is with Allah; nay, you are a people who are tried.
rows.transliteration: qāluṭ-ṭayyarnā bika wabiman ma`ak ۚ qāla ṭā-irukum `indallāh ۖ bal antum qawmun tuftanūn

rows.arabic: وَكَانَ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ تِسْعَةُ رَهْطٍ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: And there were in the city nine persons who made mischief in the land and did not act aright.
rows.transliteration: wakāna fil madīnati tis`atu rahṭiy yufsidūna fil-arḍi walā yuṣliḥūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ تَقَاسَمُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُۥ وَأَهْلَهُۥ ثُمَّ لَنَقُولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِۦ مَا شَهِدْنَا مَهْلِكَ أَهْلِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
rows.translation: They said: Swear to each other by Allah that we will certainly make a sudden attack on him and his family by night, then we will say to his heir: We did not witness the destruction of his family, and we are most surely truthful.
rows.transliteration: qālū taqāsamū billāhi lanubayyitannahu wa-ahlahu thumma lanaqūlanna liwaliyyihi mā shahidnā mahlika ahlihi wa innā laṣādiqūn

rows.arabic: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا وَمَكَرْنَا مَكْرًا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan while they perceived not.
rows.transliteration: wa makarū makran wa makarnā makran wahum lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ مَكْرِهِمْ أَنَّا دَمَّرْنَـٰهُمْ وَقَوْمَهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: See, then, how was the end of their plan that We destroyed them and their people, all (of them).
rows.transliteration: fanẓur kayfa kāna `āqibatu makrihim annā dammarnāhum waqawmahum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: فَتِلْكَ بُيُوتُهُمْ خَاوِيَةًۢ بِمَا ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: So those are their houses fallen down because they were unjust, most surely there is a sign in this for a people who know.
rows.transliteration: fatilka buyūtuhum khāwiyatan bimā ẓalamū ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan liqawmiy ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَأَنجَيْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: And We delivered those who believed and who guarded (against evil).
rows.transliteration: wa-anjaynal ladhīna āmanū wakānū yattaqūn

rows.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَـٰحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
rows.translation: And (We sent) Lut, when he said to his people: What! do you commit indecency while you see?
rows.transliteration: walūṭan idh qāla liqawmihi ata-tūnal fāḥishata wa-antum tubṣirūn

rows.arabic: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تَجْهَلُونَ
rows.translation: What! do you indeed approach men lustfully rather than women? Nay, you are a people who act ignorantly.
rows.transliteration: a-innakum lata-tūnar rijāla shahwatan min dūnin nisā-i ۚ bal antum qawmun tajhalūn

rows.arabic: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوٓا۟ أَخْرِجُوٓا۟ ءَالَ لُوطٍ مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
rows.translation: But the answer of his people was no other except that they ~s said: Turn out Lut's followers from your town; surely they are a people who would keep pure!
rows.transliteration: famā kāna jawāba qawmihi illā an qālū akhrijū āla lūṭin min qaryatikum ۖ innahum unāsun yataṭahharūn

rows.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرْنَـٰهَا مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: But We delivered him and his followers except his wife; We ordained her to be of those who remained behind.
rows.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wa-ahlahu illam-ra-atahu qaddarnāhā minal ghābirīn

rows.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
rows.translation: And We rained on them a rain, and evil was the rain of those who had been warned.
rows.transliteration: wa-amṭarnā `alayhim maṭarā ۖ fasā-a maṭarul mundharīn

rows.arabic: قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلَـٰمٌ عَلَىٰ عِبَادِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱصْطَفَىٰٓ ۗ ءَآللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: Say: Praise be to Allah and peace on His servants whom He has chosen: is Allah better, or what they associate (with Him)?
rows.transliteration: qulil ḥamdu lillāhi wasalāmun `alā `ibādihil ladhīnaṣ-ṭafā ۗ ālllāhu khayrun ammā yushrikūn

rows.arabic: أَمَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ حَدَآئِقَ ذَاتَ بَهْجَةٍ مَّا كَانَ لَكُمْ أَن تُنۢبِتُوا۟ شَجَرَهَآ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ يَعْدِلُونَ
rows.translation: Nay, He Who created the heavens and the earth, and sent down for you water from the cloud; then We cause to grow thereby beautiful gardens; it is not possible for you that you should make the trees thereof to grow. Is there a god with Allah? Nay! they are people who deviate.
rows.transliteration: amman khalaqas samāwāti wal-arḍa wa-anzala lakum minas samā-i mā-an fa-anbatnā bihi ḥadā-iqa dhāta bahjatim mā kāna lakum an tunbitū shajarahā ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ bal hum qawmun ya`dilūn

rows.arabic: أَمَّن جَعَلَ ٱلْأَرْضَ قَرَارًا وَجَعَلَ خِلَـٰلَهَآ أَنْهَـٰرًا وَجَعَلَ لَهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ حَاجِزًا ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Or, Who made the earth a restingplace, and made in it rivers, and raised on it mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier. Is there a god with Allah? Nay! most of them do not know!
rows.transliteration: amman ja`alal-arḍa qarāran waja`ala khilālahā anhāran waja`ala lahā rawāsiya waja`ala baynal baḥrayni ḥājizā ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ bal aktharuhum lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: أَمَّن يُجِيبُ ٱلْمُضْطَرَّ إِذَا دَعَاهُ وَيَكْشِفُ ٱلسُّوٓءَ وَيَجْعَلُكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Or, Who answers the distressed one when he calls upon Him and removes the evil, and He will make you successors in the earth. Is there a god with Allah? Little is it that you mind!
rows.transliteration: amman yujībul muḍṭarra idhā da`āhu wayakshifus sū a wayaj`alukum khulafā-al-arḍ ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ qalīlan mā tadhakkarūn

rows.arabic: أَمَّن يَهْدِيكُمْ فِى ظُلُمَـٰتِ ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ وَمَن يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦٓ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ تَعَـٰلَى ٱللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: Or, Who guides you in utter darkness of the land and the sea, and Who sends the winds as good news before His mercy. Is there a god with Allah? Exalted by Allah above what they associate (with Him).
rows.transliteration: amman yahdīkum fī ẓulumātil barri wal baḥri wa man yursilur riyāḥa bushran bayna yaday raḥmatih ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ ta`ālallāhu `ammā yushrikūn

rows.arabic: أَمَّن يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ وَمَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: Or, Who originates the creation, then reproduces it and Who gives you sustenance from the heaven and the earth. Is there a god With Allah? Say: Bring your proof if you are truthful.
rows.transliteration: amman yabda-ul khalqa thumma yu`īduhu wa man yarzuqukum minas samā-i wal-arḍ ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ qul hātū burhānakum in kuntum ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: قُل لَّا يَعْلَمُ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْغَيْبَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: Say: No one in the heavens and the earth knows the unseen but Allah; and they do not know when they shall be raised.
rows.transliteration: qul lā ya`lamu man fis samāwāti wal-arḍil ghayba illallāh ۚ wa mā yash`urūna ayyāna yub`athūn

rows.arabic: بَلِ ٱدَّٰرَكَ عِلْمُهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى شَكٍّ مِّنْهَا ۖ بَلْ هُم مِّنْهَا عَمُونَ
rows.translation: Nay, their knowledge respecting the hereafter is slight and hasty; nay, they are in doubt about it; nay, they are quite blind to it
rows.transliteration: balid-dāraka `il-muhum fil-ākhirah ۚ bal hum fī shakkin minhā ۖ bal hum minhā `amūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا كُنَّا تُرَٰبًا وَءَابَآؤُنَآ أَئِنَّا لَمُخْرَجُونَ
rows.translation: And those who disbelieve say: What! when we have become dust and our fathers (too), shall we certainly be brought forth?
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna kafarū a-idhā kunnā turāban wa-ābā-unā a-innā lamukhrajūn

rows.arabic: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا هَـٰذَا نَحْنُ وَءَابَآؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: We have certainly been promised this, we and our fathers before; these are naught but stories of the ancients
rows.transliteration: laqad wu`idnā hādhā naḥnu wa-ābā-unā min qablu in hādhā illā asāṭīrul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: قُلْ سِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: Say: Travel in the earth, then see how was the end of the guilty.
rows.transliteration: qul sīrū fil-arḍi fanẓurū kayfa kāna `āqibatul mujrimīn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُن فِى ضَيْقٍ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: And grieve not for them and be not distressed because of what they plan.
rows.transliteration: walā taḥzan `alayhim walā takun fī ḍayqin mimmā yamkurūn

rows.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: And they say: When will this threat come to pass, if you are truthful?
rows.transliteration: wayaqūlūna matā hādhal wa`du in kuntum ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: قُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعْضُ ٱلَّذِى تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
rows.translation: Say: Maybe there may have drawn near to you somewhat of that which you seek to hasten on.
rows.transliteration: qul `asā an yakūna radifa lakum ba`ḍul ladhī tasta`jilūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: And surely your Lord is the Lord of grace to men, but most of them are not grateful.
rows.transliteration: wa inna rabbaka ladhū faḍlin `alan nāsi walākinna aktharahum lā yashkurūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
rows.translation: And most surely your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they manifest.
rows.transliteration: wa inna rabbaka laya`lamu mā tukinnu ṣudūruhum wa mā yu`linūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا مِنْ غَآئِبَةٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا فِى كِتَـٰبٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: And there is nothing concealed in the heaven and the earth but it is in a clear book.
rows.transliteration: wa mā min ghā-ibatin fis samā-i wal-arḍi illā fī kitābin mubīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ يَقُصُّ عَلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَكْثَرَ ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
rows.translation: Surely this Quran declares to the children of Israel most of what they differ in.
rows.transliteration: inna hādhal qur-āna yaquṣṣu `alā banī isrā-iyla aktharal ladhī hum fīhi yakhtalifūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And most surely it is a guidance and a mercy for the believers.
rows.transliteration: wa innahu lahudan waraḥmatun lil-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِى بَيْنَهُم بِحُكْمِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: Surely your Lord will judge between them by his judgment, and He is the Mighty, the knowing.
rows.transliteration: inna rabbaka yaqḍī baynahum biḥukmih ۚ wahuwal `azīzul `alīm

rows.arabic: فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَى ٱلْحَقِّ ٱلْمُبِينِ
rows.translation: Therefore rely on Allah; surely you are on the clear truth.
rows.transliteration: fatawakkal `alallāh ۖ innaka `alal-ḥaqqil mubīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّكَ لَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَلَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْا۟ مُدْبِرِينَ
rows.translation: Surely you do not make the dead to hear, and you do not make the deaf to hear the call when they go back retreating.
rows.transliteration: innaka lā tusmi`ul mawtā walā tusmi`uṣ ṣummad du`ā-a idhā wallaw mudbirīn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ بِهَـٰدِى ٱلْعُمْىِ عَن ضَلَـٰلَتِهِمْ ۖ إِن تُسْمِعُ إِلَّا مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَهُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Nor can you be a guide to the blind out of their error; you cannot make to bear (any one) except those who believe in Our communications, so they submit.
rows.transliteration: wa mā anta bihādil `umyi `an ḍalālatihim ۖ in tusmi`u illā man yu-minu bi-āyātinā fahum muslimūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا وَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَخْرَجْنَا لَهُمْ دَآبَّةً مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ تُكَلِّمُهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلنَّاسَ كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا لَا يُوقِنُونَ
rows.translation: And when the word shall come to pass against them, We shall bring forth for them a creature from the earth that shall wound them, because people did not believe in Our communications.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā waqa`al qawlu `alayhim akhrajnā lahum dābbatan minal-arḍi tukallimuhum annan nāsa kānū bi-āyātinā lā yūqinūn

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ فَوْجًا مِّمَّن يُكَذِّبُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
rows.translation: And on the day when We will gather from every nation a party from among those who rejected Our communications, then they shall be formed into groups.
rows.transliteration: wayawma naḥshuru min kulli ummatin fawjan mimman yukadhhibu bi-āyātinā fahum yūza`ūn

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءُو قَالَ أَكَذَّبْتُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِى وَلَمْ تُحِيطُوا۟ بِهَا عِلْمًا أَمَّاذَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Until when they come, He will say: Did you reject My communications while you had no comprehensive knowledge of them? Or what was it that you did?
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā jā-ū qāla akadhhabtum bi-āyātī walam tuḥīṭū bihā `il-man ammādhā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: وَوَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِم بِمَا ظَلَمُوا۟ فَهُمْ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
rows.translation: And the word shall come to pass against them because they were unjust, so they shall not speak.
rows.transliteration: wawaqa`al qawlu `alayhim bimā ẓalamū fahum lā yanṭiqūn

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِيَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَٱلنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Do they not consider that We have made the night that. they may rest therein, and the day to give light? Most surely there are signs in this for a people who believe.
rows.transliteration: alam yaraw annā ja`alnal layla liyaskunū fīhi wan nahāra mubṣirā ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَفَزِعَ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَكُلٌّ أَتَوْهُ دَٰخِرِينَ
rows.translation: And on the day when the trumpet shall be blown, then those who are in the heavens and those who are in the earth shall be terrified except such as Allah please, and all shall come to him abased.
rows.transliteration: wayawma yunfakhu fiṣ ṣūri fafazi`a man fis samāwāti wa man fil-arḍi illā man shā-allāh ۚ wakullun atawhu dākhirīn

rows.arabic: وَتَرَى ٱلْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةً وَهِىَ تَمُرُّ مَرَّ ٱلسَّحَابِ ۚ صُنْعَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَتْقَنَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَفْعَلُونَ
rows.translation: And you see the mountains, you think them to be solid, and they shall pass away as the passing away of the cloud-- the handiwork of Allah Who has made every thing thoroughly; surely He is Aware of what you do.
rows.transliteration: wataral jibāla taḥsabuhā jāmidatan wahiya tamurru marras saḥāb ۚ ṣun`allāhil ladhī atqana kulla shay-ī ۚ innahu khabīrun bimā taf`alūn

rows.arabic: مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُۥ خَيْرٌ مِّنْهَا وَهُم مِّن فَزَعٍ يَوْمَئِذٍ ءَامِنُونَ
rows.translation: Whoever brings good, he shall have better than it; and they shall be secure from terror on the day.
rows.transliteration: man jā-a bil ḥasanati falahu khayrun minhā wahum min faza`iy yawma-idhin āminūn

rows.arabic: وَمَن جَآءَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ فَكُبَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فِى ٱلنَّارِ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And whoever brings evil, these shall be thrown down on their faces into the fire; shall you be rewarded (for) aught except what you did?
rows.transliteration: wa man jā-a bis sayyi-ati fakubbat wujūhuhum fin nāri hal tujzawna illā mā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَآ أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ رَبَّ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْبَلْدَةِ ٱلَّذِى حَرَّمَهَا وَلَهُۥ كُلُّ شَىْءٍ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: I am commanded only that I should serve the Lord of this city, Who has made it sacred, and His are all things; and I am commanded that I should be of these who submit;
rows.transliteration: innamā umirtu an a`buda rabba hādhihil baldatil ladhī ḥarramahā walahu kullu shay-ī ۖ wa-umirtu an akūna minal muslimīn

rows.arabic: وَأَنْ أَتْلُوَا۟ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَقُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُنذِرِينَ
rows.translation: And that I should recite the Quran. Therefore whoever goes aright, he goes aright for his own soul, and whoever goes ' astray, then say: I am only one of the warners.
rows.transliteration: wa-an atluwal qur-ān ۖ famanih-tadā fa-innamā yahtadī linafsih ۖ wa man ḍalla faqul innamā ana minal mundhirīn

rows.arabic: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ سَيُرِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ فَتَعْرِفُونَهَا ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And say: Praise be to Allah, He will show you His signs so that you shall recognize them; nor is your Lord heedless of what you do.
rows.transliteration: waqulil ḥamdu lillāhi sayurīkum āyātihi fata`rifūnahā ۚ wa mā rabbuka bighāfilin `ammā ta`malūn
